alert.note: Alert for Cibola (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 4:36PM MDT until July 31 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN CIBOLA COUNTY... At 436 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area, focusing over the Castillo and San Jose Canyons just north of San Fidel and Cubero. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Laguna Pueblo, Cubero, San Fidel, New Laguna, Skyline-Ganipa, Mesita, Paraje, Seama, Encinal, North Acomita Village, Acomita and Acomita Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 98 and 114. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
